sub_title: Energy Transition | Energy & Chemical Products | Leadership | Governance | CSR
summary: I am an energetic and driven energy professional with experience in both the technical and the non-technical domain. In my current role I am continuously looking for ways to support Shell Nederland in contributing to the Dutch society in fulfilling the local energy needs. I help to find solutions in the context of the Shell Group Strategy and actively seek for opportunities in the energy domain on a global scale. As a production technologist I have gained deep insights in the Upstream Oil & Gas business with thorough understanding of the sub-surface and surface technical disciplines and the interfaces and integration between them. My skills in connecting technical and non-technical domains, being able to communicate in a clear and effective manner and inspiring others to contribute as well, help me to be effective in one of the most challenging and relevant domains for society: energy, now and in the future.

profile_positions.description:
In this role I am responsible for supporting the President Director and the Leadership team of Shell Nederland B.V. in integrating the strategic country agenda with the Shell functions and respective Lines-of-business in The Netherlands. Furthermore, I support the management team in project management and coordination tasks and I actively seek alignment between the functions and businesses where required.

Key highlights/responsibilities:
-	Facilitate and coordinate the strategic agenda of Shell Nederland Leadership team
-	Facilitate and coordinate the strategic agenda of Shell Nederland Country Coordination team 
-	Support the President Director and Leadership-team in preparation of senior engagements, both internally and externally
-	Keep track of and drive actions related to the 2018/2019 strategic agenda for Shell Nederland B.V.
-	Promote cross-functions and cross-business integration by introducing novel ways of working in the team
profile_positions.title: Business Advisor & Strategy Delivery Manager

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for leading the Wells, Reservoirs and Facilities Management (WRFM) team in Production Unit (PU) East of the Onshore Asset in NAM. Responsible for driving the WRFM performance of Production Unit East (~1 bcm/y natural gas) with a strong focus on cost effective (~€55 mln/y OPEX total) and safe production optimization and restoration. Results are delivered in strong cooperation with Production Operations, C&WI and other stakeholders.

Key highlights:
•	Leading the integrated WRFM Team and member of the PU Leadership Team
•	Drive continuous improvement by leading and supporting Wave projects
o	Embedding elements of Agile to drive team efficiency
o	Competitively scope “legacy” systems to arrive at Fit-4-Future solutions
o	Improve employee engagement in the WRFM team by actively distributing OL-roles and organizing monthly cross-function learning sessions
•	Manage the WRFM opportunities and projects (incl. budget of € 3.9 mln in 2018)
•	Improve team cohesion by organizing regular team events, recognition of above and beyond achievements and promote field visits
•	Consider impact of activities and plans on external stakeholders and support/join the ER-team for external engagements to safeguard the NAM license-to-operate
•	Manage expectations of internal and external stakeholders related to Must Win projects
o	Support and lead the De Wijk Ph2 Enhanced Gas Recovery Project start-up
o	Support the controlled closure of GZI Sour gas system
•	Coach the WRFM team on technical and non-technical matters and support the development junior staff in the WRFM team
profile_positions.title: WRFM Lead & Production Technologist

profile_positions.description:
Production Technologist in the Shell Graduate Programme and Shell Advanced Technical Programme

Oct 2015 - Apr 2017: Working as Production Technologist in the WRFM (Wells, Reservoir,and Facilities Management) team on the Land North cluster, responsible for all the onshore NAM assets in the North of the Netherlands excluding Groningen (Gas).

Dec 2013 - Dec 2015: Working as PT in the WRFM  team on the Schoonebeek Asset. The Schoonebeek Redevelopment project is an Enhanced Oil Recovery (EOR) project in the Nederlandse Aardolie Maatschappij. With the use of low pressure steam injection additional volumes are produced from the Schoonebeek oilfield on top of the first stage recovery which was produced in the period1946 - 1996.

Tasks and responsibilities:
- Assurance and monitoring of Well Integrity for all wells (including water disposal wells)
- Design, plan and support the execution of surveillance jobs
- Artificial Lift optimization (LSU (beam) pump and PCPs) interventions
- Production System Optimization focal point
- Optimization of the well operation envelopes and windows
- Analysis of failure behavior of production wells
- Analysis of thermal cycling of steam injection wells
- Involved in projects for water disposal solutions
- Involved in projects related to high H2S production

profile_positions.description:
Field Assignment as part of the Shell Graduate Programme.

Responsibilities:
- Update and build Prosper models

Design proposals for completion, workovers and interventions
- ESP installation and change-out
- Hydraulic Fracking
- TCP /  WL Perforation
profile_positions.title: Production Technologist

profile_positions.description:
Part-time advising organisations in the following fields:
- Lifecycle Management of Capital Assets
- Lifecycle Costing
- Asset Performance Assessment and Optimization
- Value Based LCM
- Development of Performance Indicators
profile_positions.title: Advisor

company.name: Defensie Materieel Organisatie, Ministerie van Defensie

profile_positions.description: Occupied with advising and assisting the deputy Director of Weapon Systems. Responsible for the operationalization and implementation of Value of Weapon Systems KPI in relation to other lifecycle management instruments.
profile_positions.title: Advisor and Weapon System Management project leader

profile_positions.description: Master thesis topic: Development of a Value Based Model which is able to assess the LCC of a weapon system with respect to possible (decision) variables in the sustainment strategy and to have this in a standardized generic form. This model can then be used to find the optimal balance between the operational performance, costs and possible other factors such as system safety. As a next step the results from this model are translated to standards in order to be used as a baseline for daily business.
profile_positions.title: Graduate Intern

profile_positions.description: Intern at the Ministry of Defense doing an assignment for the staff of the directorate of weapon systems into researching possibilities and solutions with respect supply chain optimization and asset management control. Specifically into inventory strategy and control.
profile_positions.title: Intern
